document_data.mainbody:
larsamryn was the royal stronghold of the kingdom of Erlkazar in the capital city of Llorbauth.
The castle was located on the northeastern side of the capital city. From the roof of the complex, one could see farming fields to the east and the citys docks on Shalane Lake to the north.
Klarsamryn contained the royal palace on its grounds. It had an outer courtyard
The kings personal audience chamber was circular with a roof supported by pillars. It included a statue of Ondeth Obarskyr, the founder of Cormyr. One of the rooms connected to this throne room was the kings private reading chamber.
The stronghold was the home of the royal family of Erlkazar, which, in the late 14 century DR, included King Korox Morkann and his daughter, Princess Mariko Morkann.
The castle was founded some 500 years before the city of Llorbauth arose around it.
